Infectra




*Infectra leans on the CR Chamber frowning and sighs*

----- Original Message -----
From: "THECODE" <thecode@...>
To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
Sent: Monday, August 28, 2000 5:15 AM
Subject: Re: Deemos strikes again...


> Airbomber's finger twitched and he rolled over in the CR Chamber. It
seemed
> that he cheated death yet again...
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "ilovealllizards" <ilovealllizards@...>
> To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
> Sent: Sunday, August 27, 2000 11:14 PM
> Subject: Re: Deemos strikes again...
>
>
> > Infectra
> >
> >
> > *Infectra frowns and a mech tear falls out of her optics. Infectra gasps
> and
> > covers her optics. Some of Artist's mech fluid had splattered on her.
She
> > had never seen part of such a horrible death scene. She felt sad that
> Deemos
> > didn't want Airbomber and if she just went with Airbomber than Deemos
> would
> > never leave her in peace. She looked at Artist's mech fluid and sighed.
> She
> > felt bad for Artist. She figured he mightive had a sad life and had to
> > suffer of lies and now this...But she never knew nothing of this bot but
> > still felt really sad for him. She takes Airbomber to the CR Room and
sits
> > him in a CR Chamber to be repaired*
> >
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: "THECODE" <thecode@...>
> > To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
> > Sent: Sunday, August 27, 2000 9:53 PM
> > Subject: Deemos strikes again...
> >
> >
> > > OOC: Oh, Iron Raptor, just to tell you this, Plintissa died because
she
> > was
> > > being ignored, seeing as how Iron Raptor became "Too good" to talk to
> any
> > of
> > > my characters.
> > >
> > > BIC: The Chosen Ones show up at the Maximal base.
> > >
> > > "Stronghold, Blender, you guys were great defenders, Rizopas, you shot
> > > KitKat, that was cool. Diskus, nice attack, Doom Ice, you were
amazing,
> > > Artist, you sucked! You got blown around, making stupid phone calls,
and
> > > generally been letting your ego get to you!" Deemos yelled.
> > >
> > > "Deemos! I don't know, I didn't mean anything!" Artist complained.
> > >
> > > "Too bad, you screwed up, come with me! Oh, yeah, Infectra, throw
> > Airbomber
> > > out, he's of no use to me anymore!" Deemos said. Airbomber hled his
head
> > in
> > > pain and fell onto the ground. He showed all of the signs of death.
> > >
> > > "Looks like you don't have to worry about him." Deemos said. Deemos
and
> > > Artist walked to a secluded area, around the base where nobody was
> > looking.
> > >
> > > "Okay, what do I have to do?" Artist asked.
> > >
> > > "I'v ebeen thinking, what you have to do is...die." Deemos said.
Artist
> > > looked at Deemos to try and get out of this, but Deemos raised a claw
> and
> > > smashed it into Artist. It went right through. Artist was brought to
his
> > > knees.
> > >
> > > "You failed, and I am not as forgiving as that idiot Megatron." Deemos
> > said.
> > > He pulled out rifle and shot Artist with it, in the head. Artist
didn't
> > have
> > > time to react before Deemos pulled a hand full of wires from his back
> and
> > > jerked out, ripping his spark out and leaving gore all over. He pushed
a
> > > button on the claw and the spark exploded. Artist's hand reached out
and
> > > grabbed a sparkle, then stopped moving.
> > >
> > > "Too compassionate." Deemos said. He dropped the wires, let the mech
> fluid
> > > run off of his fingers and slicing Artist up. He stored the piecesin a
> > > freezer and made note that it was a package that needed to be kept
cold.
> > >
> > > "I hope all of you are hungry." Deemos said before walking inside of
the
> > > base with mech fluid dripping off of his fingers. Doom Ice and Rizopas
> > > looked at each other. Stronghold and Blender both shrugged. Diskus
> > swallowed
> > > hard and loud...
> > > ----- Original Message -----
> > > From: "Megan Solmonson" <tmrattrap@...>
> > > To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
> > > Sent: Sunday, August 27, 2000 9:44 PM
> > > Subject: Re: Plan B
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > > Uh, Yanshosh. Iron Raptor is actually standing up by the window now.
But
> > you
> > > might have not gotten the post that states that so maybe we can just
say
> > > that Prowl stood up and went to her? Just a small bit that fixes it
all
> > up,
> > > huh?
> > >
> > >
> > > * Iron Raptor nodded but didn't turn and watch Arcangle and Silver
Sting
> > > leave, listening but also watching her finger trace small designs on
the
> > > glass of the window.
> > > Her mind was still reeling about Arcangles plan, thinking of just what
> she
> > > needed to do to pull it off smoothly. She already knew that they
needed
> to
> > > repair the Ark and get those engines set up and online before they
even
> > > thought of placing the Autobots in it. Not to mention they needed Iris
> to
> > > make up the proper auto-pilot system for the flight into the Earth's
> > orbit,
> > > something that was going to be the toughest part of this mission yet.
> > > Iron Raptor shook her head slightly, there was so much to do and so
much
> > to
> > > worry about. In all her life she had never been so busy.
> > > But then Felines voice broke through her concentration, tilting her
head
> > > slightly in the fembots direction as she listened to her speak.*
> > >
> > > " I don't need to forgive you for anything, Feline. You have problems
> and
> > > we'll just have to work around them until you bring them to an
> > > understanding."
> > >
> > > * She then watched Feline exit the room in the corner of her eye, then
> > > turning her head and looking out of the window again with a sigh. Her
> mind
> > > going back to the mission at hand as well as the one they had to get
> down
> > to
> > > as soon as they got back.
> > > Either mission couldn't be too difficult, she had to admit that there
> were
> > a
> > > fair amount of events that could go wrong but they would work around
> them.
> > > But then she heard Felines dainty foot-steps again, wondering just why
> the
> > > fembot was returning for. But once she heard Feline speak she knew.*
> > >
> > > " Room 6-20 and just up from the hallway where the armory is located.
> You
> > > can't miss it."
> > >
> > > * Iron Raptor had actually paid attention to where Prowl had taken her
> > after
> > > her Alliance ordeal, looking at the details of the rooms she passed
and
> > > making note of their locations.
> > > But now there were more important things to worry about, like thinking
> > about
> > > the condition of Tavatron and Dinobot when they found them. Thinking
> about
> > > how close they would be to the Alliance base and how attack was more
> > likely
> > > then anything else, lucky as hell if they weren't.
> > > Though, as her finger traced another pattern in the glass she felt a
> hand
> > > slip around her but knew whom it was. She would always know Prowl's
> touch,
> > > and the feel of it nearly made her forget that he had gotten her back
> with
> > > an insult that had gone just a little bit too far.
> > > Iron Raptor's optics narrowed at the thought of that insult, knowing
> that
> > > she really wasn't angry about it but a woman's weight was a touchy
thing
> > and
> > > she didn't like it made fun of. Though, her revenge for that insult
> wasn't
> > > through yet.
> > > But when she heard Prowl speak and looked up seeing her own reflection
> in
> > > the glass but actually looking at Prowls. *
> > >
> > > " Yes. I'm going with Arangles plan. It's fairly clever if you think
> about
> > > it long enough, and has a very high possibility of actually working."
> > >
> > >
> > > * Her mind was wondering again from the thoughts about their missions,
> > > actually dwelling on the feel of his touch instead of them. But then
she
> > > shook her head slightly to clear it, reminding herself that she was
> still
> > in
> > > the process of making him pay for that insult.
> > > Iron Raptor looked down at his hand on her waist and then up at him,
her
> > > expression being that of a look that reflected her words. *
> > >
> > > " And just what do you think YOU'RE doing?"
> > >
> > > * She put a hand on her hip and the other on his that was on her
waist,
> > her
> > > fingers working to pry each one of his from the grasp her had on her.
*
> > >
> > > " 'Heavy as a TRUCK,' huh? Well, you think you can just come over here
> and
> > > touch me like this? I think not."
> > >
> > > * At the last word she finally pried his hand free and let it fall,
then
> > > taking a few steps away from him and walked over to the projector and
> > turned
> > > it off. Making sure that she swung her hips a bit while she had walked
> to
> > > tease him. *
> > >
> > > " You're going to pay for the insult, Mister. And this is your
> > > punishment.until you learn you lesson."
> > >
> > > * And it was, that he wasn't allowed to touch her for a little bit. Of
> > > course she would stop once he learned his lesson, slag knew that she
> > > wouldn't be able to keep this up forever. *
> > >
> > >
> > >
